poem:
"Under the Vibrations of the Mellotron"

Ah, Pinder, beneath a moored sky,
The Mellotron's whir - your legacy.
Each chord, a cosmos in night's satin.
Songwriter standing on the edge of sounds,
In Days of Future Passed, you cradled
Time in your palm; a berry sweet and heavy,
Brought forth the language of nights,
Voice lost to the ether's wild symphony. 

Lament not, Pinder; in the quiet, we still hear.
